website_summaries.verdict: Allows for precise placement of nail with design of nose. Excellent quality from trusted brand.
pros: Works with a variety of lengths of 18-gauge brad nails from 0.625 to 2.125 inches
Easy to remove any jams that occur without need for tools
Multiple operation modes for a variety of jobs
Exhaust in the rear to keep expelled air out of the operator's face
Doesn't require oil, which reduces mess
cons: Larger than average size brad nailer, which limits work in tight spaces

customer_reviews.title: great gun, broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked this gun, especially the narrow point which allowed very accurate placement. Light and easy to use. I used it several times a day for three months when it quit working. Warranty repair said an O ring failed preventing the hammer from reseting. I will keep using it and keep my fingers crossed. From reviews before I bought it, I expected trouble free operation for at least a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart Point makes it easy to locate nail location
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a brad nailer for small furniture projects. I was looking for an easy to use, low maintenance gun that didn't need added oil and was light. The weight is light, but similar to other top brand nailers. But I love the low maintenance feature of this nailer and the smart point tip makes it easy to locate nail locations for this part-time DIYer. The tip also prevents the surface you're working with from getting scratched/dented. 100% recommend this brad nailer. I also have the angled 15 ga. finish nailer that is awesome, so adding this to my tool chest was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JoeS

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Jams like crazy and the depth control did not work out of the box. No matter what you set the depth at it just drove the brads as far as it could.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Very Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 Porter Cable Nailers, but purchased this Bostitch for its purported accuracy in setting brads. It is dead on! Easy to see where the brad is going to be set and easily adjustable for setting the depth of the brad in wood. Just wish I had purchased this earlier. Build quality is superior to the latest from Porter Cable and most other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Sale Ed

customer_reviews.title: I find that even though I adjust the nut that ...
customer_reviews.text: I find that even though I adjust the nut that controls the amount of force on the head of the brads, often times they are still slightly proud so that I have to go back and manually hit the head with a hammer to make them flush with the wood. The wood is poplar or pine and not even hardwood. I have a Craftsman and a Hitachi that never have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: ucsfsmile

customer_reviews.title: Was this unit returned and just sent back out?
customer_reviews.text: This unit seems to have been opened and repacked. The brad gun seems to be OK coming out of the box, but I have not loaded and tried it yet. Additionally, the unit was advertised to include 3-each no-mar heads. The one on the gun looks OK, but the other 2 were not in the kit. Was this kit returned and just sent back out with the next order without being inspected? Somewhat disappointing. Will follow up if the brad gun does not function as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade to the traditional gun.
customer_reviews.text: We have used many different nail guns over the years in our professional industry, the last one that worked well for us for a few years with no issue was a bostitch,,, after it finally gave up we decided to try out this new one instead of fixing the old one. Great idea! This new technology works.............so far ;) You get one clean hole instead of big dents all around the hole as most of these 18g nail guns are famous for. The whole is clean enough that with a touch of filler you can fill the hole without having to worry about how to fix nearby dents. Buy it,, you will like it!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: If it is good enough for Norm, it's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have been VERY happy with this purchase. This unit replaces my cordless Passload nailer which worked only about half of the time. Sure, I have to lug around a compressor now, but this brad nailer works without any issues. I use this mostly with furniture making. The brads consistently sink just the right distance below the wood surface, regardless if I am nailing pine, oak, or maple.
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical after reading the one and two star review but this nailer worked great right out of the Box. Really like the smart point feature with allows for a more precise nail location. Does not dent the soft pine i am using and leaves a small hole the size of the nail. My old nailer slammed it’s nailing tip down so hard that I spent lots of time filling the dents it made. I’m thinking some of the problems folks are having with constant jamming might be the result of bad quality nails. I use Bostitch nails on all of my nailers.
customer_reviews.author: Low Tech Redneck

customer_reviews.title: A significant improvement over an already great nailer
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous generation of brad nailer, and this is a huge improvement over what was already a great reliable product. The precision you have with this is fantastic. The pointed tip makes it easy to set a brad exactly where you want it. The tool is fairly light-weight, which also help with the precision. Despite being light, it has a very solid and well-built feel to it. The nailer design is well thought-out. The way the top comes apart by just flipping up the top is a nice touch, as is the simple way nail depth is adjusted with a wheel near the trigger. Way nicer than the old interface.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Birge

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple of months, however the actuation mode switch and lockout trigger came apart. There is now no way to put on the safety or dial in the driving force to the nail.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Worked extremely well to build my pantry. I'm glad we didn't buy a cheaper alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Lolita Wike

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this a few weeks to re-install interior baseboard and quarter-round. Very lightweight and easy to control. This was my first time purchasing a pneumatic brad gun, so I did lots of research before. I haven't had any misfires, but am using the tool on the lowest pressure setting for the narrow brad nails. I plan on using this for other interior trim and light furniture projects, so I hope it holds up for many years.
customer_reviews.author: dustin

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this nailer.
customer_reviews.text: My new toy. Stand back or I'll staple you to the wall. I used this to completely redo my garage shelving. Very pleased with the performance and ease of use. It comes in a nice sturdy hard plastic case. I wish the case had some extra storage space for additional Brads or staples. Sure beats a manual stapler.
customer_reviews.author: Kenms

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gun
customer_reviews.text: I’m a professional trim carpenter. I’ve had the gun for a few weeks now. I’ve run over 5000 nails through it. I really enjoy using this gun. The tip is great. I’ve used sencos most of my career but the reviews on the new guns weren’t great. This guns a lot cheaper too.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B.

customer_reviews.title: Using it since May 2017
customer_reviews.text: I'm only a hobbyist woodworker with less than 1000 nails fired from this tool, but it hasn't jammed on me yet. I have fired all lengths to 2 inch nails from different brands with this nailer and they all worked fine. Very useful when gluing wood and time is a constraint because liquid glue can be a lubricant to wood.
customer_reviews.author: EdA

customer_reviews.title: Great gun, however. ....
customer_reviews.text: Nice brad gun. Love the fact you can get in tight spots and shoot toe nails easily, however, on the second rack of nails, the plastic piston ring broke making the gun inoperable. The part costs $2 plus the s&h came to around , $10 total. Just sucks that i had to already repair a brand new tool.
customer_reviews.author: patrick kelleher

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice tool.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this nail gun with multiple sizes of brads, I have not had a single jam or any other issues. This gun is extremely light weight and appears to be well-made. The only complaint I have is the air exhaust vents down, this results in blowing dust in your face every time you shoot a brad.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: Nice nailer
customer_reviews.text: After shopping around I found these to be just right. It has worked flawlessly and has made some jobs quite easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Used for two projects so far, no jams. I’m not a contractor and have never used an air nailer, but this was plug-n-play easy. Takes a few nails to know the best way to hold it, but it’s fantastic. Wish I had bought one years ago!
customer_reviews.author: MyTwoCents

customer_reviews.title: Good Brad Nailer
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well. I was using it on white oak, and the compressor was a Dewalt D55140 1-Gallon, so pretty small. This nailer put 2" brads into the oak with clean results every time. I've only used this nailer a couple times, but it doesn't seem like it's going to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Robicheux

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Reliable Bead Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used a lot but is what I needed for a small project. Have a Bostitch stapler for 35 years that’s still good for occasional use. No jams yet. Comes with case & air connector attached. Does not come with any brads.
customer_reviews.author: Gaspasser

customer_reviews.title: Works great, doesn't mar the surface
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten quite a bit of use out of this over the last couple years. It does a great job, doesn't jam and just does what it's supposed to do. The tip does not damage the surface at all unlike a cheaper nail gun I have. It's a really handy gun to tack stuff together and great for doing trim work.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: adjustable for depth and trigger operation Cons: Don't know yet, will be putting it to installing a hard as rock bamboo floor soon so we will see if it is up to the task. I will update my review after I torture it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: TurtleWax

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Initially it did not fire consistently and I was going to return it but my bad. The pressure on compressor was on 50. After increasing to 90, it worked great. I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is lightweight, easy to use and easy to load. It comes with a belt hanger, at first I didn't think I would use it and actually took it off of the nail gun, but after climbing up and down a ladder I reattached the belt hanger and found it to be very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bort

customer_reviews.title: Awesome nail gun
customer_reviews.text: This gun rocks - using with my Bostitch BTFP02012 6 Gallon compressor. Shot 5/8" to 2" nails yesterday and all worked flawlessly - no misfires and love the smart point as it makes it easy to see exactly where you are shooting the nail. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: JohnF

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I now own three Dewalt nail guns and this gun is as good as my six year old ones. If you ever owned a Dewalt product then you know how good they are. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: larf1

customer_reviews.title: WANT PURCHASE ANY MORE OF THIER PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.text: This is June 20 and the brad nailer quit working. I called the 800 # for support and the automated system said (sorry we can’t talk now). I went ahead and disassembled the gun to see if I might be able to fix. Well, it working but if you pull the trigger, it will fire a nail out (very unsafe). Purchased on May 11th. (SAD)
customer_reviews.author: Cathy A

customer_reviews.title: Great brad nail gun.
customer_reviews.text: This oil free brad nail gun works very smooth and is easy to use. It was a great purchase. I am a DIY home improvement person so I can't say if this is commercial grade but for projects around the house it is great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Modica

customer_reviews.title: Love this Bostich brad stapler!!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this Bostich!! What a fabulous brad stapler. Love the small guide on it - you really ca clearly see exactly where you are placing your staple and it gets tighter into corners than any other brad stapler we've used. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L to tell

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight gun
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and easy to use. One jam in a blue moon. Belt hook is wonderful and it even has a pencil sharpener and extra ‘smart tips’. The pencil sharpener doesn’t actually function well but great idea
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great gun for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great nail gun for the price. Easy to use once you have the right sized nails and know how to put them in. I’ve used it for a few different projects so far. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Dallymon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m a finish carpenter so the gun gets used a lot so I bought 3. I like the gun but they don’t hold up, I’ve had 2 break down on me now 1 won’t fire at all and 1 misfires constantly, all within a 2 year time frame. I’m on my 3rd one and can’t justify buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for the husband
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for the husband. Does what is expected of it!
customer_reviews.author: Coleen Walczak

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: It works great for my antique restoration. The small tip allows me to place the fasteners just where I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Strickland

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for finished work of all kinds. Great durable case is very nice! Great name good price, works phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: TDM

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, easy to use, reliable, drives brads properly. Has a soft plastic boot to minimize denting.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: Great brad nailer!
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this Bostitch Brad nailer. Bostitch makes quality tools! I’ve been using it for wainscoting and hard wood flooring and it works great! I will continue to use Bostitch tools as they continue to have great, quality tools!
customer_reviews.author: Annie H.Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 6 year old 18 Gauge Bostich that bit the dust. So far I am fairly happy with it. It's accurate and very easy to use. I find that it actually does leave a mark on the wood so that is why I am giving it 4 stars. Also, I am glad the pencil sharpener is removable. I found it annoying, but was able to take it right off. All in all, a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Uconn97

customer_reviews.title: Bostitch nailed it!
customer_reviews.text: The new favorite at the shop, bought three of these already.
customer_reviews.author: Kinsey C.

customer_reviews.title: Great nail gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great nail gun. It is light weight and very accurate in nail placement. I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Depth adjustment isn't perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Depth adjustment isn't perfect; have not tested much but there is limited indication showing where on the scale of things the depth is set. For example: can be set that a shallow depth but one could not tell by looking at the gun.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Great Brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough about this nailer. It works so well and is lightweight. The only down side is that you can't easily see when you are out of nails.
customer_reviews.author: Todd from Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: Great brad nailer, installed baseboards, quarter round, and cabinetry trim with this guy and it has not jammed once! Happy with this tool and can’t wait to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Bostitich Product
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, has long warranty, light in weight, making it easy to use, functions perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: k4zmb

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I especially like that open nosed design that allows me to precisely locate the position in which the brad will go in.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Decker

customer_reviews.title: Nice gun
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase a gun online, but this one worked out well. Nice gun easy to use and very high quality. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L Eggleston

customer_reviews.title: time will tell
customer_reviews.text: as a finish contractor, i've used several pinner guns. all of them have the saftey about 1/4" behind where the nail comes out. very awkward for edge nailing. no such issue with this one. but.... my experience with oil less tools is that they don't last as long. time will tell
customer_reviews.author: fghtds

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very light and the dial a depth is a nice feature. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no problems
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no jams and sinks nails. What else is there to say
customer_reviews.author: JD419

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help install 3/4" oak hardwood flooring because heavier gauge (15) would not fit in some tight spaces. I was at first a little doubtful but is seems to do the job and drives 2" fasteners perfectly and they are almost invisible. Works well on base and trim moulding too.
customer_reviews.author: Bigguy5x5

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: No problems yet. Seems to be working great so far and I like the smart point to get exact nail placement in small areas.
customer_reviews.author: SuperGuy

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: Solid built. Chose this over any other brand due to extensive research and was not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dixon

customer_reviews.title: No issue
customer_reviews.text: fast and easy , just as described , good buy .
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool and very well thought out!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to use when you are doing crown moldings up on the ladder. Guys - I have used Hitachi, Paslode and Porter Cable and this one is much more advanced!
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Svistun

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: this thing is awesome. i trimed a whole house with this thing and and built tons of wood projects.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: WOW. Lightweight, precise placement. drives 2" 18 ga nails perfectly. A few misses through about 1500 nails.
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart Point safety is BY FAR the best design I ...
customer_reviews.text: Smart Point safety is BY FAR the best design I have used in my 35 years as a finish carpenter. It is the ONLY gun I NEVER considered modifying the safety on. Nuff said
customer_reviews.author: S. W. Raborn

customer_reviews.title: Should last beyond 200 nails
customer_reviews.text: Used very little but seal broke on the drive piston, drive pin would not return all the way in. Have to buy rebuild kit to repair.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren H. Schook

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for diy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and you do not have to press too hard to activate. Does not dent wood and allows for a wide variety of nails.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for installing quarter round
customer_reviews.text: To install the quarter round molding on a new laminate floor, this nailer is absolutely indispensable. Took no time to get set up and adjusted, drives every nail consistently and haven't seen any kind of malfunction. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool 4/5 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but good things. No jams after 1000 brads. Easy jam clearing should it pose an issue. Great brad depth selector works well with my Cali Air Tools compressor. I did take out the existing air fitting and replaced it with a ball socket air fitting for less strain on the hose in tight spaces, but it no longer fits in the plastic case.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, High value, Should last
customer_reviews.text: This brad nailer works GREAT! My first BN but none the less, works as needed and no jams to date. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: nice tool. I like the feature where the nailer ...
customer_reviews.text: nice tool. I like the feature where the nailer won't fire if it is empty. Unfortunately this tool does not have it.
customer_reviews.author: IT

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to use. Most guns jam after a while, it never happened and we used it for hours!
customer_reviews.author: S. Barker

customer_reviews.title: This nailer is amazing. So much better than the Masterforce one I ...
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is amazing. So much better than the Masterforce one I was using. I have used it for 3-4 projects now and I have had 0 jams. Easy to load and use. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Frost_Trunks

customer_reviews.title: Pro grade tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a pro grade tool, sinks Brad's effortlessly and does not matter the surface. Overkill for a home owner but I enjoy nice things.
customer_reviews.author: SFBayCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Really like the way you can place the tip accurately
customer_reviews.text: Really like the way you can place the tip accurately. It doesn't have the safety that sticks way out from the tip so its easy to see where you are placing the nail.
customer_reviews.author: J Shore

customer_reviews.title: He loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son for his birthday. He loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Gay Anschultz

customer_reviews.title: ... a spice rack and it performed flawlessly and with great accuracy!
customer_reviews.text: Just built a couple floating shelves and a spice rack and it performed flawlessly and with great accuracy!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Kremer

customer_reviews.title: Great finish gun...
customer_reviews.text: Great finish gun, I'm i professional carpenter and i tried lot's of gun definitely this is a great gun it's light and until now work fine with no problem work every day and shoots like first day.
customer_reviews.author: Vitor Sousa

customer_reviews.title: Reliable tool
customer_reviews.text: Bistitch makes the best.. the 15 ga. Locks up the nails but this 18ga is reliable
customer_reviews.author: Mark Edingburg

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gun. No more oiling. Rite out of the box fired a couple hundred nails 1.25 and 5/8 no jams or misfires. Very light Spend the extra for the smart point !!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gibson

customer_reviews.title: well designed compared to other comparitively priced guns. No ...
customer_reviews.text: well designed compared to other comparitively priced guns. No jams thus far (only have shot ~100 nails); have tried sizes from 5/8 up to 1 3/4 with no problems thus far. Bostitch needs an updated 23 gauge pin nailer with this system.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Using to make wood art. Easy to use with wide variation of pins. Had two other nailers and they didn’t handle the job.
customer_reviews.author: Manetta Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great little gun
customer_reviews.text: Easy to load, depth adjustment works well, nice case. Always amazed these small guns are so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Fryer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of problems
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but problems with this item. Poor feed and jams all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Using this frequently - works great - easy to load, very ergonomic, no jams so far.
customer_reviews.author: tbird

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best brad nailer. tiny tip is great, just with the belt clip was closer to the air port.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Great brad nailer!
customer_reviews.text: Its a great little brad nailer for the money and holds up well to a heavy workload!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: name brand
customer_reviews.text: having had a Bostitch in the past I wouldn't even think of another brand
customer_reviews.author: F. J. Mercede

customer_reviews.title: Hidden Pencil Sharpener???
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many brad nailers and this is by far the best. Yesterday I discovered that the belt hook had a built-in pencil sharpener. What a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Sue G.

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice tool, and works consistently.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. I would have preferred a little heavier gauge capability as it is a little light for wall trim, but it's fine for joint glue adhesion and similar light fastening requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Diablo

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for projects around the house. Price was great and few times I have used it has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This has been on the job for about a month ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been on the job for about a month and has quickly become the crew's most popular brad nailer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pidd

customer_reviews.title: I love the smart point on this
customer_reviews.text: I love the smart point on this, have been using it for about two weeks now and I am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Flores Family

customer_reviews.title: I recommend another nailer
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to buy this nailer i would recommend buying a container of wood putty to fill all of the misfires you're going to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm looking for other stuff to build so I can use it more.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new using this tool but it was easy to learn and use. Did the dob. Now I'm looking for other stuff to build so I can use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Bosco Peterman

customer_reviews.title: It works as expected : )
customer_reviews.text: This Bostitch brad nailer works much better than my Ridgid. Ease of use and precision. It was sold less than than local home improvement stores. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: suegee

customer_reviews.title: light weight
customer_reviews.text: I love it its easy to use and its light weight
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without it ...
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable tool ... From 5/8" to 2" brads ... This nailer hasn't skipped a beat. I've used it with Bostitch brads and some from Harbor Freight ... works every time ...
customer_reviews.author: FAA Retired

customer_reviews.title: love this nailer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brad nailer! Really appreciate the improved design so you can tell exactly where the nail is going!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Well  made tool
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of plastic used as on some other brands that i looked at.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Newland Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Brad Nailer.
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be my favorite tool. I had a similar version of the Bostitch before and the end piece (where the nail comes out) kept falling off. This one has been improved. We bought another brand but it was heavy, bulky and the end was very wide and you couldn't see where you were placing the nail. My husband and I did our den walls in pine boards and this nailer did the job. It get's up close to the wall to do the edges. It's not bulky. Nice handle for easy gripping. I do the nailing while he does the cutting of the wood. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: Great accurate nailer. One of my most frequently used tools. Very comfortable grip. Easy to use. Feels like excellent long lasting quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Nice, But
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, but it tends to "hang" a staple in the injection channel periodically, otherwise it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: rlg

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it recently received the top recommendation in one of the wood magazines. It lives up to its name -- easy to load and use with no misfires or other problems.
customer_reviews.author: Just somebody

customer_reviews.title: ... the nailer on one job so far but I like the way all functions are set up
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the nailer on one job so far but I like the way all functions are set up ; and it worked perfectly . I has a wide range of fastener lengths . That is why I chose this model.
customer_reviews.author: Mike from NY

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: have not had to use it a lot but the gun works well
customer_reviews.author: joe Darc

product_meta.title: BOSTITCH Nail Gun, Brad Nailer, Smart Point, 18GA (BTFP12233)
product_meta.description:
Style:2 1/8'' Oil Free, Smart Point Brad NailerThe BOSTITCH BTFP12233 Smart Point 18GA Brad Nailer Kit is the perfect tool to be used for cabinetry, upholstery and paneling. It allows you to choose from trigger system and countersinking options that best meet your project needs. The Smart Point Technology allows for easy nail placement as a result of a smaller nose compared to current BOSTITCH nailers and no need to compress the contact trip to actuate the tool. It drives 18 GA brad nails from 5/8" to 2-1/8" length. Oil-free operation reduces the risk of oil stains. Tool-free jam release mechanism for easy nail removal, Dial-A-Depth control for precise countersinking of brad nails, along with a selectable trigger system for sequential or contact operation. 

Other Features: 1/4" air fitting, rear air exhaust, & belt hook with integrated pencil sharpener. 
Specifications: Magazine Angle = Straight, Magazine Capacity = 100, Magazine Loading: Side Load, No Mar Pad, Operating Pressure = 70-120 psi.
Kit Includes: Nailer, 1/4" Air Fitting, Carrying Case and Extra No-Mar Tips
feature_bullets: SMART POINT TECHNOLOGY: Easy nail placement due to a smaller nose and no need to compress the contact trip to actuate the tool.
DRIVES: 18 GA Brad Nails from 5/8" to 2-1/8" length.
TOOL-FREE JAM RELEASE MECHANISM: For easy nail removal.
DIAL-A-DEPTH(TM) CONTROL: For precise countersinking of nails.
KIT INCLUDES: Nailer, 1/4 inch Air Fitting, Carrying Case and Extra No Mar Tips
